name: Parks & Rex
body: An exercise in imagination and creative exploration, Parks & Rex was built alongside a team of peers while studying web development at Southern Methodist University.  As the third and final major group project at university, the Parks & Rex codebase demonstrates proficiency with many modern web development technologies, both front and back end.  The application depends on React, Node, Express, Apollo, and MongoDB, among many other incredible tools.

name: Dayspaw
body: Built with a team of peers while studying web development at Southern Methodist University, Dayspaw is an enterprise application, designed to be used by a doggie daycare business to manage appointments and customer records.

name: Mood Ring
body: My first ever collaborative coding project, The Mood Ring is a unique application focused on delivering an aesthetic experience. The user explores the relationship between color, meme, and sound.

name: Cara Bella
body: My first paid project beyond graduation, this page was built as a central hub for spa owner Tricia Kelly to direct potential customers.  We have future plans to implement a scheduling/appointments feature, rendering this a full-stack enterprise application.

name: GroupMaker.js
body: Inspired by the challenges of a teaching role, this command-line utility parses, reads, and writes files containing students' gpa scores.  Within a few simple commands, the user can produce a csv or json-formatted file containing group assignments for the contained students, algorithmically assigned with the goal of balance.  The algorithm  distributes students across disparate score categories, eliminating the need to make difficult decisions about group assignments for projects and beyond.
